article.title: Prospects for indirect dark matter searches with MeV photons

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following energy-loss processes becomes increasingly important for electrons and positrons with energies below 100 MeV?
Which secondary emission component provides the dominant contribution to the gamma-ray signal below ~20 MeV in the case of dark matter annihilation into electron-positron pairs?
Compared to existing limits from the diffuse γ-ray flux, by what factor are projected upper limits from future MeV missions (like e-ASTROGAM) expected to improve for monochromatic photon signals?
choices: Less than one order of magnitude

multiple_choice_question.text: For which leptonic annihilation channel does final-state radiation (FSR) provide the dominant contribution to the upper limits at all dark matter masses?
choices: Cascade annihilation to e+e− through a mediator
